g.text: combination with a 45 nm layer of TPBi (1,3,5-tris(1-phenyl-
evidences the beneﬁcial eﬀects of HBLs by
comparison with HBL-free devices. The best-eﬃciency devices
were those employing a 15 nm layer of B3PYMPM as an HBL
and a 45 nm layer of TPBi as an ETL. These devices
presumably beneﬁt from hole localization in the emissive layer
and from the additional barrier for the electron injection (at
TPBi), thereby balancing the barrier existing for the injection
of holes. This device architecture, together with the judicious
optimization of the NC puriﬁcation (the choice of solvents and
nonsolvents and their amounts, as well as number of
puriﬁcation steps etc.), yielded a champion green device,
centered at 515 nm was characterized by EQE values of up to
9.8%. High EQE values are satisfactorily retained at higher
current densities, allowing for obtaining brightness of 34 700
. Other reports on LEDs employing CsPbBr
DDAB treatment have presented EQE values of 7
Blue-emitting LEDs were fabricated with the device
structure proposed by Gangishetty et al., where a TFB
phenyl) diphenylamine)]) layer covered with Naﬁon per-
ﬂuorinated ionomer (PFI) is used as an HTL for improved
EL peak at 480 nm. While EQE of
OLA/OA-synthesized NCs), the brightness was approximately
). We should also note that we were not able to fully
suppress the EL from the TFB layer (at
application of PFI, presumably because of the suboptimal
thickness of the perovskite NC layer and hence electron
Figure 3. (a and b) SEM cross-sectional image and corresponding schematic of the blue LED stack. (c) Work function of electrodes and
band gap values of the diﬀerent materials used in the LED stack, energies vs vacuum. (d) Current density and luminance of the devices with
various EL peak positions as a function of voltage. (e and f) EQE of the devices with various EL peak positions as a function of current
Figure 4. (a) EL spectra of the LEDs. Legend reveals corresponding EL peak position. Inset shows photo of the EL of the operating device
with Empa logo. (b) Commission Internationale de l’E
clairage CIE 1931 color diagram. Black triangle represents BT.2020 (Rec2020) color
coordinates. Red dots mark coordinates of LEDs presented in this work.
